text: Nuno Herlander Simões Espírito Santo (born 25 January 1974), or simply Nuno, is a Portuguese football manager and former footballer who played as a goalkeeper. He was most recently head coach of Tottenham Hotspur. ==Managerial statistics== Managerial record by team and tenure Team Nat From To Record Rio Ave 15 May 2012 19 May 2014 Valencia 4 July 2014 29 November 2015 Porto 1 June 2016 22 May 2017 Wolverhampton Wanderers 31 May 2017 23 May 2021 Tottenham Hotspur 30 June 2021 1 November 2021 Total ==Honours== ===Player=== Deportivo *Copa del Rey: 2001–02 Porto *Primeira Liga: 2002–03, 2003–04, 2007–08, 2008–09 *Taça de Portugal: 2002–03, 2008–09 *Supertaça Cândido de Oliveira: 2003, 2004, 2009 *UEFA Champions League: 2003–04 *UEFA Cup: 2002–03 *Intercontinental Cup: 2004 *Taça da Liga runner-up: 2009–10 Individual *Ricardo Zamora Trophy: 1999–2000 (Segunda División) ===Manager=== Wolverhampton Wanderers *EFL Championship: 2017–18 Individual *La Liga Manager of the Month: September 2014, December 2014, February 2015 *EFL Championship Manager of the Month: November 2017 *LMA Manager of the Year: 2017–18 EFL Championship *Premier League Manager of the Month: September 2018, June 2020, October 2020, August 2021 ==References== ==Other websites== * * *National team data * Category:1974 births Category:Living people Category:Portuguese association football goalkeepers Category:Olympians for Portugal Category:Footballers at the 1996 Summer Olympics Category:UEFA Euro 2008 players Category:Portuguese football managers Category:Valencia CF managers
title: Nuno Espírito Santo
